intro: Ficus hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan fig, is a species of flowering plant native to southern China. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows up to 10 meters in height. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in inflorescences, which are followed by edible fig fruits. Ficus hainanensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
